Author: Alice#9607
Content: Is it possible to create an dico similar to the EOS ico?

Author: Alice#9607
Content: Over a certain timeframe coins can be contributed to a pot. When the time is over a fixed amount of coins get distributed to all contributors to the pot proportionally.

Content: https://eosscan.io

Author: namhoang28#4328
Content:
I've updated all dependencies to the newest version in last week. Now you need node > 10 to run dICO app. I suggest using node v10.13.0 since I use it in my laptop.
https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/dicoapp-e/blob/develop/package.json#L278
And there are also some people have problem with marketmaker app in dICO repo. Please try to replace it with latest version here before you run it:
https://github.com/artemii235/SuperNET/releases/tag/v1.0.942
The application should run normally after that
Let me know if you still get any problem
I will update document in this week. It needs a clear instruction¬†guide

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
Apart from running the `develop` branch of the dicoapp-e repo, I have an other question. I want to offer a coin in exchange for BTC or KMD. The coin at the top is the coin that can be bought. Right now the balance of the offered coin is 0. What do I have to do to have a balance here?

I think the answer is something like this:

- Make sure that the electrum server `electrum1.cipig.net` can find liquidity for coin 'X'. As soon as there's liquidity, the amount of tokens for 'X' goes from 0 to a higher amount. From that moment it's possible to buy available tokens via BTC/KMD using the dICO-app.

Is my assumption above correct?

Author: ca333#0118
Content: @namhoang28 @bartwr - that pubkey is the bob-pubkey! You need to set up a bob from which the price gets fetched explicitly - doing it based on market-offering can lead to unpleasant situations (underbidding you with "empty" orders, etc.)

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
fyi I have the dico-app 'master' branch running well. Tested it with KMD/[coin] & BTC/[coin] swaps. Works great.

I've seen the new `develop` branch as well - this one looks better than the `master` & has lots of improvements. Can't make it run locally yet, will test later on.

Anyhow. Just saying that the dico-app does what it should do. Nice.

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: I don't know your exact purpose, but there is on-chain token creation available on any asset-chain built using komodo. It's numbers are virtually limitless as `1 base-token = 10^8 on-chain tokens` https://docs.komodoplatform.com/cc/contracts/tokens/introduction.html

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you want to accept bitcoin

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: which means either all nodes need to run a bitcoin node (impractical) or you use cross chain proofs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: additionally the cross chain proofs need to be used to issue new coins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: gateways CC does most of this, but it uses the locked coins that are only released when valid proofs are submitted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it is blockchain enforced as to freely movable coins, as the locked coins are locked until a valid cross chain proof is submitted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but this requires a source of bitcoin merkleroots

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the cross chain burn protocol could be modified to do a one way coin create, but still a source of bitcoin merkle roots are needed and this change needs to be made at the core level
